article:
September 1 was my first day at Phillips Academy, my new school. It was also my 18th birthday. I received a warm  _  from my host family--- the Steins. Gena was my host mum, and her daughter Lily would also be a new  _  at Phillips. They took me to the school and   _  me around the campus.
On our way to my dorm , we saw a huge truck delivering a student's   _   to her room. Many students at the school were very rich, and they would fill their dorms with decorations. But I was   _  not to because I thought it was a   _  of time and money.
I had a single room, which was about the   _  of a Chinese college dorm --- the ones which usually hold six people.   _  she helped carry my bags, Lily asked me, "What's your favorite   _  ,Teresa?" I thought for a moment before answering, "Orange." I didn't know why she had asked the question.
We   _   an introduction meeting after dinner.   _  of the students were native English speakers, so I felt a little   _  . I returned to my room after the   _  , tired and wanted to go to bed after a (n)   _  day. When I opened my door, I found a big   _  .The bed was perfectly made with blankets and an orange sunflower pillow. On the   _  was a sunflower-pattern mat while a color1ful lamp  _  beside the bed. I opened my mouth,   _  . How beautiful!
There was also a   _  card. I touched the little pillow on the bed as I read the card. A warm current   rushed through my  _  .
